meanings.definition: Arranged in a series of levels or grades.
meanings.sent1: The echeloned shelves in the store displayed the products beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The echeloned seating at the event ensured everyone had a good view.
meanings.sent3: The echeloned cupcakes at the party were a hit, each one tastier than the last.
meanings.sent4: Her echeloned approach to studying led to steady progress in her grades.
meanings.sent5: The echeloned garden beds created a stunning visual effect in the backyard.

meanings.sent1: The echeloned soldiers marched in perfect formation.
meanings.sent2: The echeloned chairs in the waiting room allowed for privacy.
meanings.sent3: The echeloned books on the shelf made it hard to find a specific one.
meanings.sent4: The echeloned trees along the path provided shade at different times of the day.
meanings.sent5: The echeloned parking spaces made it easy for everyone to find a spot.

meanings.sent1: The echeloned approach to the project ensured each task was completed before moving on.
meanings.sent2: The echeloned levels of the building allowed for easy access to each floor.
meanings.sent3: The echeloned boxes in the storage room made it look like a staircase.
meanings.sent4: Her echeloned schedule helped her stay on track with her daily activities.
meanings.sent5: The echeloned rows of seats in the theater provided a clear view of the stage for everyone.
